text: Those Who Have Wealth but Do Not Enjoy It Are Pitiful
Here is another misfortune that I have seen under the sun, and it \add is\add* prevalent among humankind.

God gives a man wealth, possessions, and honor, so that he lacks nothing his heart desires; yet God does not enable him to enjoy it—instead someone else ends up enjoying it. This \add is\add* vanity—indeed, it \add is\add* a grievous ill!

Even if a man fathers a hundred \add children\add* and lives many years so that the days of his years are many, if his heart\f + \fr 6:3 \ft Or “his soul” \f* is not satisfied with ⸤his prosperity⸥\f + \fr 6:3 \ft Literally “the good” \f* and ⸤he does not receive a proper burial⸥,\f + \fr 6:3 \ft Literally “and also there is no burial for him” \f* I deem the stillborn better than him.
For he comes into vanity and departs into darkness, and his name is shrouded in darkness.
He has neither seen nor known the sun, yet he has more rest than him.

Even if a man\f + \fr 6:6 \ft Hebrew “he” \f* lives a thousand years twice, if he\f + \fr 6:6 \ft Hebrew “and” \f* does not enjoy ⸤prosperity⸥,\f + \fr 6:6 \ft Literally “good” \f* ⸤both suffer the same fate⸥!\f + \fr 6:6 \ft Literally “are not the all going to the same place?” \f*
One Must Learn to Be Content with What One Has
All of a man’s toil \add is\add* for his mouth—
yet his appetite is never satisfied.
So do the wise \add really\add* have an advantage over fools?

⸤Can the poor \add really\add* gain anything by knowing how to act in front of others⸥?\f + \fr 6:8 \ft Literally “What \fq is there \ft for the poor knowing \fq how \ft to conduct themselves before the living?” \f*
⸤Better to be content with what your eyes see
than for your soul to constantly crave more⸥.\f + \fr 6:9 \ft Literally “Sight of the eyes \fq is \ft better than wandering of desire” \f*
This also \add is\add* vanity and chasing wind!
It is Futile for Humans to Complain about God’s Irresistible Will
Whatever is—it was already determined,
⸤what will be—it has already been decided⸥.\f + \fr 6:10 \ft Literally “and his name is known what he \fq is \ft man” \f*
As for man, he cannot argue
against what is more powerful than him.
⸤Increasing words only multiplies futility⸥,\f + \fr 6:11 \ft Literally “\fq Where \ft there \fq are \ft numerous words, \fq it \ft makes numerous vanity” \f*
how does that profit anyone?
The Future is Inscrutable to Humans

For who knows what \add is\add* good for a man in his life during the few days of his fleeting life, which are fleeting as a shadow? For who can tell anyone what will happen ⸤in the future⸥\f + \fr 6:12 \ft Literally “after him” \f* under the sun?
